alert.note: Alert for Aguila Valley; Buckeye, Avondale; Northwest Valley; Tonopah Desert (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 05 at 10:25PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa County through 1115 PM MST... At 1025 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Wittmann, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Surprise, Wittmann, Circle City, White Tank Mountain Park, Luke AFB and Beardsley. This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 123 and 139. AZ Route 303 between mile markers 109 and 120. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Aguila Valley; Buckeye, Avondale; Northwest Valley; Tonopah Desert
